name: milk pastilla
ingredients: For the cream (mhalbi): 150 ml of milk, 2 tsp of cornstarch, 1 tbsp of orange blossom water, 3 tbsp of powdered sugar
For the almonds: 100 g of blanched almonds, 4 tbsp of powdered sugar, 3 tbsp of sunflower oil
Brick pastry sheets (2 sheets for one mini-pastilla)
steps: Prepare the cream: Take a little milk and mix it with the cornstarch. In a saucepan, heat the remaining milk and the orange blossom water. Add the cornstarch/milk mixture while stirring. Let it thicken for a few seconds. Remove from heat and let cool in the fridge.
Prepare the almonds: Heat the oil in a pan and add the almonds. When they are golden, drain them and let them cool. Then blend them with the sugar.
Shaping the mini-pastillas (or rounds): Fold the brick pastry sheets. Cut out rounds. Place them on a baking sheet, brush with melted butter, and bake until golden in a preheated oven at 180Â°C.
Assembly: Spread a layer of almond powder on a round of brick pastry. Cover with a layer of cream. Add another layer of almond powder. Finish with a second round of golden brick pastry.
Sprinkle with cinnamon and powdered sugar. Serve cold.
